peeragogical-action-review.intention-review: A user-friendly way to create “wraps” for various aspects of the Peeragogy Project. We want to make this tool applicable to other as-yet-unknown tracks of the Project.
peeragogical-action-review.what-happened: We are getting to know each other and our individual priorities and skills. This helps us identify ways we can each contribute to the unified mission/goal. Questions from non-technical participants inform the design.
peeragogical-action-review.what-happened-perspectives: We are making Bratwurst. Some of us see the individual molecules of the sausage, others see the bubbling juice and anticipate how the mustard will mingle with the savory meat.
peeragogical-action-review.learnings-changes: We learned new perspectives. We discussed refinements to the sausage-making process. We learned that with persistence, eventually the participants extract value and see the end goal.
peeragogical-action-review.what-else-should-change-going-forward: Keep investigating, stay open to refinements. Keep the END USER in mind, the non-technical person. Keep the waves coming in! Meet people/users where they are.
